page.title: 15THORPE ARCH TRADING ESTATE
page.content:
Originally Thorpe Arch Trading Estate was the site of a munitions factory in the second World War. Now it is a sprawling estate, covering about two kilometres, of wharehouse and factory buildings, all laid out in neat rows separated by small straight roads.
Most of the buildings are used as wharehouses rather than big producing factories employing many workers.
Altogether in our area of the Trading Estate there are 146 business premises. The majority of businesses have manufacturing workshops and offices. Most of the factories are small having less than 50 workers and one or two manufactures only have a hand full of employees.
